channel.title: Programming on Coding life
channel.description: Recent content in Programming on Coding life

item.title: DRY - Don’t Repeat Yourself
item.description: DRY(Don’t Repeat Yourself) aims at reducing the repetition of code chunks and patterns, which was first defined in the book The Pragmatic Programmer as “every piece of knowledge must have a single, unambiguous, authoritative representation within a system.” In this article, we are going to discuss this principle in details.
